Reviews.Title: Good enough camera
Reviews.Author: K. Tolliver "Ivy's Mom"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 17 year-old son who is quite tech savvy (compared to myself). I've read the previous reviews about "grainy" pics, but once you figure out how the make adjustments the pictures come out just fine. It takes good pictures, has a decent enough zoom lense, and allows him to edit photos on the camera.  It has a lot of other options to that he seems to be quite happy about. He carries it to school daily and is always taking pictures of friends and such and they upload directly to his computer via a USB cable. He doesn't use the camera box since he carries the camera around like his cell phone, and he gave the crayons to his 3 year-old sister. Two gifts in one! LOL. The camera is very easy to use and I'd recommend it for someone just starting out using ditigal cameras, or someone in HS or junior high who takes daily random shots of a bunch of other teens/friends.

Reviews.Title: Great except for the slow shutter!
Reviews.Author: James Price
Reviews.Content: Overall I like the camera and the quality of the photos. The camera is easy to operate. The buttons are clear and simple. The only problem I have is when trying to take pictures of something that moves. The slow response time from the time you press the button until the shutter closes is so slow that I cannot take pictures of the baby, for example. Children move so quickly that I can never capture the shot I want: the baby has already moved, or his eyes are closed, or the smile is gone - it just loses the spontaneity.

Reviews.Title: You can't go wrong with this, seriously ... extremely pleased!
Reviews.Author: Lyrce
Reviews.Content: This is a lot of camera for your money.I was pleasantly surprised at the features and photo quality for this price.Ordered the black; got the aqua blue - not a big deal to me as I am not taking photos of the camera. It's cute, actually. Couldn't find the xd adapter card at first, -argh!-, but it (little orange thing) turned up in the larger box with the case (black) and crayons, whew! Put in a 4G micro card; after changing the compression to "fine," which I always use, it reported I had room for 500 pictures - half the number you can fit at "normal" compression. Use "fine" for everything. You can definitely see the difference in the quality of your photos.I am still exploring all the features of this camera. The scene modes are a nice timesaver, and the magic filters - did not expect that! -  are quite fun. The movies with sound do NOT lose audio when you zoom, despite reports to the contrary, but naturally you can hear a click. It is easy to operate, and the photos are vibrant and crisp and full of detail. Now, you would not use this to photograph a wedding, but for everyday, walkaround, wow, look at that! use it is pretty hard to beat.Yes, it is a bit "plasticy," but not flimsy - and plastic also makes it very light. Get batteries in a drugstore in a pinch. Big, bright, clear LCD monitor. The pictures are perfectly focused if you take the picture correctly - wait for the green focus box to appear. (I have yet to see a blurry one .. I RTFM.) And unlike your average fancycam, it arrives with a sturdy if simple padded case, so you just throw it in your bag and go. No worries. No $25 for a case either. And my nieces and nephews will all love the coloring stuff.Great purchase. Very happy. Get yourself one.

Reviews.Title: Grreat starter camera
Reviews.Author: C. Jensen
Reviews.Content: Great little camera for the price.  Takes great pictures.  One pro is the use of regular AA batteries - no need to recharge a special battery.  One con - does not seem to play back videos on the camera with sound.  You must go through computer or TV to hear audio.  But overall, a good starter camera for teens.

Reviews.Title: Camera is OK..
Reviews.Author: Jessica Kelley "jk"
Reviews.Content: The camera is ok. The actual pictures don't turn out to good for it being a 11 megapixel. I bought it for the crayola feature but wish i wouldve gotten a kodak camera instead. Good for teens and young adults. Not good for adults wanting to caputure good pictures of kids and sports!!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Melanie Billiu
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves this camera.  She loves the fact that she can print the picture and then color it herself.  She is always using it.  I am not a fan of the box, I would have preferred something a little more sturdier due to the fact that it was supposed to be a keepsake box.

Reviews.Title: FE 46
Reviews.Author: Forestry Major
Reviews.Content: good camera especially for the price makes a good gift and is great for taking pictures of the family and such but its not a camera for more advanced users. but if you need a camera to take simple picture and even short video of friends and family this will do the job nicely.

Reviews.Title: Terrible photos
Reviews.Author: Kelly K
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera so that we would have a small camera that took videos and took photos.  While the video is alright, the pictures are terrible quality.  The pictures are often VERY blurry - I don't even  bother trying anymore they are so bad.  Terribly disappointing - would definitely NOT recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Poor image quality
Reviews.Author: OnlineReviewer "OnlineReviewer"
Reviews.Content: Simply put, this camera takes poor quality pictures. My first and last Olympus. Very disappointed. Don't believe me? Order it, try it -- then return it.

Reviews.Title: Not good for capturing children's moments or in poor light
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Maples "momof3boys"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 6 months now.  I wish I had bought something else.  My boys are 3, 8 and 10 and this camera has a hard time capturing a picture of them without blurring.  Also, I notice it has a really hard time if you are not in direct sunlight.  We recently were in the redwood forest in the middle of the day, but very shady and I could NOT get a good picture on ANY setting.  I typically have to take several pictures to get one that is not blurry or clear.  Never had this problem with other cameras, so I wouldn't call it operator error.  I think I'm just going to give it to my kids.  Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Value-priced camera
Reviews.Author: X742W4DP "CW04(DP)USN, Ret."
Reviews.Content: This Olympus FE-46 was a replacement for an equally value-priced GE camera which broke when I pressed hard on the LCD screen. The MENU function "buttons" are ICONS on the LCD screen and takes awhile getting used to. It takes average quality pictures and below average quality in bright sunlight. The videos are below average quality because most video clips turned out to be over-exposed. The video segments can only be 10 seconds long, so I have to take several 10-second segments to finish a long session. It takes better pictures and videos than a camera-phone, and considering the price I paid for it, I consider it a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Julie E. Teague "Beach Girl"
Reviews.Content: Love this camera!  Compact but great zoom.  Only con, is instructions are all on a CD and not in print - for this low techie.

Reviews.Title: Excellent low cost point & shoot
Reviews.Author: KIM JONG CHEOL
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for only $69.16.Why has the cost increasd?This camera is really good for its price.Buy it! I'm strongly recommending it for you!

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: Dean
Reviews.Content: I"m amazed at what a great deal this little camera turned out to be. It's nice and small but with a hefty feel to it. It's got really great features, excellent zoom up to 5x, and very good MP.  All in all excellent!

ProductInfo.Features:
5x optical zoom; 12-megapixel resolution for photo-quality prints up to 20 x 30 inches
6 months access to crayola.com/ColorMe; enhance images online
AF Tracking technology; choose from three in-camera Magic Filters
2.7-inch LCD; Edit images in-camera; Red-Eye Fix, Lighting Fix, Resizing and Cropping
Capture images to xD-Picture Card or microSD (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Olympus FE-46 12MP Digital Camera Black Crayola Kit with 5x Optical Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD, 64 pack of Crayons and Storage Box
